member.name: M:Tridion.Collections.Set`1.Contains(`0)
member.summary: Determines whether the contains a specific value.
member.param: The object to locate in the .
member.returns: True if item is found in the ISet; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Set requires an equality implementation to determine whether keys are equal. The default generic equality comparer EqualityComparer.Default is used. If type Item implements the System.IEquatable generic interface, the default equality comparer uses that implementation.

member.summary: Copies the elements of the to an Array, starting at a particular Array index.
member.param: The one-dimensional Array that is the destination of the elements copied from . The Array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.

member.name: M:Tridion.Collections.Set`1.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Removes the first occurrence of a specific object from the .

member.summary: Throws an exception if the value of a given parameter is null.
member.param: The parameter value
The parameter name (used in exception message)
member.exception: Raised if the value of a given parameter is null.

member.name: M:Tridion.CommonUtilities.AssertArgumentNotNullOrEmpty(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Throws an exception if the value of a given parameter is null, an empty string or an empty collection.
member.param: The parameter value
The parameter name (used in exception message)
member.exception: Raised if the value of a given parameter is null.
Raised if the value of a given parameter is an empty string or a empty collection

member.name: M:Tridion.CommonUtilities.AssertValidEnumValue(System.Type,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Asserts that a specific value is allowed to be used as the enumeration value. Currently only checks if the 'UnknownByClient' value is not used.
member.param: The specific type of the enumeration to validate against
The value to be validated (any enumeration type or integer)
The property name under test
member.remarks: The 'UnknownByClient' value is used by enumeration types to support legacy clients. When the current client version is older that the service version and an enumeration value added in the new version has to be sent to the client, it is replaced by the 'UnknownByClient' value, so the client can recognize that fact and not interpret the returned value. The 'UnknownByClient' value must not be set by the client itself, so the validation on the service side is used to not allow this.

member.name: M:Tridion.CommonUtilities.DowngradeEnumValue``1(``0@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Downgrades the enumeration value to the specific data contract version. If the value's declaration has a specified, and the contract version on the attribute is greater than the requested version, the enumeration value is replaced with the 'UnknownByClient' value. In all other cases the provided enumeration value is not changed.
member.typeparam: The enumeration type - usually inferred by the compiler
member.param: A reference to the enumeration value to downgrade (both nullable and not nullable types are supported)
The requested contract version to downgrade the value to
member.remarks: The 'UnknownByClient' value is used by enumeration types to support legacy clients. When the current client version is older that the service version and an enumeration value added in the new version has to be sent to the client, it is replaced by the 'UnknownByClient' value, so the client can recognize that fact and not interpret the returned value. The 'UnknownByClient' value must not be set by the client itself, so the validation on the service side is used to not allow this.

member.name: M:Tridion.CommonUtilities.DowngradeEnumValue(System.Object,System.Int32)
member.summary: Downgrades the enumeration value to the specific data contract version. If the value's declaration has a specified, and the contract version on the attribute is greater than the requested version, the enumeration value is replaced with the 'UnknownByClient' value. In all other cases the provided enumeration value is not changed.
member.param: Enumeration value to downgrade (both nullable and not nullable types are supported)
The requested contract version to downgrade the value to
member.returns: The downgraded value.
member.remarks: The 'UnknownByClient' value is used by enumeration types to support legacy clients. When the current client version is older that the service version and an enumeration value added in the new version has to be sent to the client, it is replaced by the 'UnknownByClient' value, so the client can recognize that fact and not interpret the returned value. The 'UnknownByClient' value must not be set by the client itself, so the validation on the service side is used to not allow this.

member.name: M:Tridion.CommonUtilities.DowngradeDataMemberValue(System.Object,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Downgrades the properties(marked with ) for specific data contract version. If input has set on it, and (if set) greater then requested version, then provided property must be set to null.
member.param: The object, which property must be downgraded if need.
Name of the property, which need to be downgraded.
The requested contract version to downgrade the value to.

member.name: M:Tridion.CommonUtilities.UpgradeEnumValue``1(System.Nullable{``0}@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Upgrades the enumeration value from the specific data contract version. This method is used to 'back-upgrade' the enumeration value downgraded by the method. If the provided value is the 'UnknownByClient' value, it is replaced with a null value. In all other cases the provided enumeration value is not changed.
member.typeparam: The enumeration type - usually inferred by the compiler
member.param: A reference to the enumeration value to upgrade (only nullable types are supported)
The requested contract version to upgrade the value from (currently not used)
member.remarks: The 'UnknownByClient' value is used by enumeration types to support legacy clients. When the current client version is older that the service version and an enumeration value added in the new version has to be sent to the client, it is replaced by the 'UnknownByClient' value, so the client can recognize that fact and not interpret the returned value. The 'UnknownByClient' value must not be set by the client itself, so the validation on the service side is used to not allow this.

member.name: T:Tridion.Configuration.ApplicationMonitoringSettings
member.summary: Represents application monitoring setting within a configuration file.

member.name: P:Tridion.Configuration.ApplicationMonitoringSettings.MonitoringAgentUdpPort
member.summary: Gets or sets the UDP port service heartbeats should be send to.

member.name: P:Tridion.Configuration.ApplicationMonitoringSettings.AutomaticServiceHeartbeatInterval
member.summary: Sets the interval between service heartbeats when using automatic service heartbeats. The interval is specified in seconds. It must be set to one second or more, and can not exceed one week.
member.remarks: The service process timeout will be set to 2.3 times the heartbeat interval to ensure a single lost heartbeat will not result in a timeout.

member.name: P:Tridion.Security.Configuration.DirectoryServiceSettings.GroupMemberAttribute
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique group member attribute.
member.remarks: This property refers to the name of the attribute to look for when searching for a user's Group. If is not provided, attribute refered by this value reprensents the groups of the users. For example, value of this attribute = memberof, and is empty, then memberof attribute of the user represents the groups that user belongs to.

member.summary: Gets or sets the filter that is used to retrieve a list of user. This filter distinguish the users from other objects.
member.remarks: If empty the is used to distinguish the users from other objects.

member.name: F:Tridion.Constants.UnknownByClientValue
member.summary: The value to be used as the 'UnknownByClient' value in an enumeration.
member.remarks: The 'UnknownByClient' value is used by enumeration types to support legacy clients. When the current client version is older that the service version and an enumeration value added in the new version has to be sent to the client, it is replaced by the 'UnknownByClient' value, so the client can recognize that fact and not interpret the returned value. The 'UnknownByClient' value must not be set by the client itself, so the validation on the service side is used to not allow this.

member.name: T:Tridion.Localization.LocalizableException
member.summary: Abstract base class for Tridion exceptions for which the message can be localized.
member.remarks: Do not log the exceptions you throw; it is the responsibility of the client application.

member.name: T:Tridion.TridionException
member.summary: Abstract base class for exceptions thrown in SDL Tridion components.

remarks.para: Since the message of exceptions thrown by SDL Tridion components should typically be localizable, custom exception classes should typically derive from class instead of directly from this base class.
Do not log the exceptions you throw; it is the responsibility of the client application.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.ItemTypes
member.summary: Defines ConstantsCommon for system defined item types.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.ItemType
member.summary: Specifies the Content Manager item types.
member.remarks: This enumeration defines both the symbolic names and numeric values for all TCM item types. The numeric values are used in TCM URIs. Note that the numeric values look like bit flags, but they are not really: repository-local, system-wide and workflow item types have overlapping bit values. Therefore, performing bitwise ORs or ANDs is dangerous; it can only be done for item types of the same "class" (repository-local, system-wide or workflow).

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.TcmUri
member.summary: Represents a native Tridion Content Manager URI which uniquely identifies a resource in the system.
member.remarks: The structure of a TCM URI is PublicationID-ItemID[-ItemType][-vVersion].

member.name: F:Tridion.ContentManager.TcmUri._tcmUriRegEx
member.summary: RegEx with a pattern of a , which has a structure of {PublicationID-ItemID}[-ItemType][-vVersion]
member.remarks:
Explanation of the optional group: (-(?<itemType>[0-9]+))?
- : start with a '-'
?<nameOfTheGroup> : give the group defined by '()' a name, which can be used to retrieve it.
[0-9] : any decimal digit
+ : there must be one or more of the preceding item (the decimal digit)
? : there must be zero or more of the preceding item (here the group defined by '()'

member.name: T:Tridion.TridionArgumentException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when one of the arguments provided to a method is not valid.

remarks.para: TridionArgumentException is thrown when a method is invoked and at least one of the passed arguments does not meet the parameter specification of the called method. All instances of TridionArgumentException should carry a meaningful error message describing the invalid argument, as well as the expected range of values for the argument.

The primary derived classes of TridionArgumentException are TridionArgumentNullException and TridionArgumentOutOfRangeException. These derived classes should be used instead of TridionArgumentException, except in situations where neither of the derived classes is acceptable. For example, exceptions should be thrown by:
TridionArgumentNullException whenever a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) is passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

TridionArgumentOutOfRangeException when the value of an argument is outside the range of acceptable values; for example, when the value "46" is passed as the month argument during the creation of a DateTime.
If the method call does not have any argument or if the failure does not involve the arguments themselves, then InvalidOperationException should be used.

member.name: M:Tridion.TridionArgumentException.#ctor(Tridion.Localization.LocalizableMessage)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TridionArgumentException class with a specified error message.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

member.name: T:Tridion.TridionArgumentNullException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a null reference is passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TridionArgumentNullException class with the name of the parameter that causes this exception.
member.param: The name of the parameter that caused the exception.

member.name: T:Tridion.TridionArgumentOutOfRangeException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the value of an argument is outside the allowable range of values as defined by the invoked method.

member.name: M:Tridion.TridionArgumentOutOfRangeException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TridionArgumentOutOfRangeException class with the name of the parameter that causes this exception.
member.param: The name of the parameter that causes this exception.

member.name: M:Tridion.TridionArgumentOutOfRangeException.#ctor(System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TridionArgumentOutOfRangeException class with the name of the parameter that causes this exception, the actual value, and the allowed minimum and maximum values.
member.param: The name of the parameter that causes this exception.
The actual value of the parameter being set.
The minumum allowed value in the valid range.
The maximum allowed value in the valid range.

member.name: M:Tridion.TridionArgumentOutOfRangeException.#ctor(Tridion.Localization.LocalizableMessage)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TridionArgumentOutOfRangeException class with a specified error message and the name of the parameter that causes this exception.
member.param: A LocalizableMessage that describes the error.

member.name: T:Tridion.TridionInvalidOperationException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a method call is invalid for the object's current state.

remarks.para: TridionInvalidOperationException is used in cases when the failure to invoke a method is caused by reasons other than invalid arguments. For example, TridionInvalidOperationException is thrown by:
MoveNext if objects of a collection are modified after the enumerator is created.
GetString if the resource set is closed before the method call is made.

If the method invocation failure is due to invalid arguments, then TridionArgumentException or one of its derived classes, TridionArgumentNullException or TridionArgumentOutOfRangeException, should be thrown instead.

member.name: M:Tridion.TridionInvalidOperationException.#ctor(Tridion.Localization.LocalizableMessage)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TridionInvalidOperationException class with a specified error message.
member.param: The message that describes the error.

member.summary: The exception that is thrown when an invoked method is not supported.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TridionNotSupportedException class with a predefined error message.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TridionNotSupportedException class with a specified error message.
member.param: A LocalizableMessage that describes the error. The content of message is intended to be understood by humans.

The application-specific error information details.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the innerException parameter is not a null reference, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

member.name: M:Tridion.TridionSoapException.CreateFrom(System.Exception,System.Web.HttpRequest,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TridionSoapException class based on an exception for a specific culture.
member.param: The exception to create the TridionSoapException from.
The request for getting the fault actor in case there is the exception is no soap exception.
The culture to localize the exception.
member.returns: A TridionSoapException.

member.name: M:Tridion.TridionSoapException.ToString
member.summary: Generates a clean SOAP fault string.
member.returns: A string respresenting a SOAP fault string.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.TridionTimeoutException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the operation timed out.
member.remarks: The default error code of this exception is TcmErrorCode.GeneralError.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.TridionTimeoutException.#ctor(System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Creates a new instance with a given inner exception which provides the details.
member.param: The inner exception.
member.remarks: The is TcmErrorCode.GeneralError.

member.name: T:Tridion.Localization.LocalizableMessage
member.summary: Represents a localizable message: a string resource name and values for the string resource's parameters/tokens.
member.remarks: If the referenced string resource contains parameter like {0}, the values of those parameters must be provided too. The parameter values can be any object (the object's implementation will be used to format the message). A parameter value may also be a LocalizableMessage instance, in which case it will be localized in the appropriate culture.

member.name: M:Tridion.Localization.LocalizableMessage.#cctor
member.summary: Initializes the static members of the LocalizableMessage class.

member.name: M:Tridion.Localization.LocalizableMessage.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LocalizableMessage class.
member.param: The name of the resource.

member.name: M:Tridion.Localization.LocalizableMessage.#ctor(System.Resources.ResourceManager,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LocalizableMessage class with a specified string resource manager.
member.param: Specifies a that will be used to lookup the string resource.
The string resource name.

member.name: M:Tridion.Localization.LocalizableMessage.#ctor(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LocalizableMessage class with specified parameter values.
member.param: The string resource name.

The parameter values can be any object (the object's implementation will be used to format the message). A parameter value may also be a LocalizableMessage instance, in which case it will be localized in the appropriate culture.

member.name: M:Tridion.Localization.LocalizableMessage.#ctor(System.Resources.ResourceManager,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LocalizableMessage class with a specified string resource manager and parameter values.
member.param: Specifies a that will be used to lookup the string resource.
The string resource name.

The parameter values can be any object (the object's implementation will be used to format the message). A parameter value may also be a LocalizableMessage instance, in which case it will be localized in the appropriate culture.

member.name: M:Tridion.Localization.LocalizableMessage.GetLocalizedMessage(System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Gets the message localized in a specified culture.
member.param: The culture used to localize the message and its parameters.
member.returns: The message localized in a specified culture.

member.name: M:Tridion.Localization.LocalizableMessage.GetLocalizedParametersValue(System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Gets the localized values for the parameters .
member.param: The culture used for the localized string.
member.returns: Array of Localized String

member.name: M:Tridion.Localization.LocalizableMessage.GetLocalizedParameterValue(System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Gets the localized parameter value.
member.param: The loc message.
The culture.

member.name: M:Tridion.Localization.LocalizableMessage.ToString
member.summary: Gets the message localized in the thread's current UI culture.
member.returns: The message localized in the thread's current UI culture.

member.name: P:Tridion.Localization.LocalizableMessage.ResourceName
member.summary: Gets the string resource name.

member.name: P:Tridion.Localization.LocalizableMessage.Parameters
member.summary: Gets the parameter values used for parameterized string resources.
member.value: The parameter values can be any object (the object's implementation will be used to format the message). A parameter value may also be a instance, in which case it will be localized in the appropriate culture.

member.name: F:Tridion.Localization.ResourceCommon.tcl_msgArgumentNullException
member.summary: Resource identifier for the string: Value cannot be null.\r\nParameter name: {0}.
member.remarks: This exception is thrown when an argument must be specified but contains null.

member.name: F:Tridion.Localization.ResourceCommon.tcl_msgArgumentEmptyException
member.summary: Resource identifier for the string: Value cannot be empty.\r\nParameter name: {0}.
member.remarks: This exception is thrown when an argument must be specified but contains an empty string or an empty collection.

member.name: F:Tridion.Localization.ResourceCommon.tcl_msgArgumentOutOfRangeException
member.summary: Resource identifier for the string: Specified argument was out of the range of valid values.\r\nParameter name: {0}.
member.remarks: This exception is thrown when an argument is out of it specified range is encountered.

member.name: F:Tridion.Localization.ResourceCommon.tcl_msgNotSupportedException
member.summary: Resource identifier for the string: Specified method is not supported.
member.remarks: This exception is thrown when a method is no longer supported.

member.name: F:Tridion.Localization.ResourceCommon.tcl_msgStartTrace
member.summary: Resource identifier for the string: Start Trace: Activity '{0}' in method '{1}' at {2} ticks.
member.remarks: The message when a trace is started

member.name: F:Tridion.Localization.ResourceCommon.tcl_msgEndTrace
member.summary: Resource identifier for the string: End Trace: Activity '{0}' in method '{1}' at {2} ticks (elapsed time: {3} seconds)
member.remarks: The message when a trace is ended that ends up in the log.

member.name: F:Tridion.Localization.ResourceCommon.tcl_msgArgumentOutOfRangeExceptionIncludingLimits
member.remarks: This exception is thrown when an argument is out of it specified range is encountered.

member.name: F:Tridion.Localization.ResourceCommon.tcl_msgApplicationMonitoringInvalidNameCharacter
member.summary: Resource identifier for the string: The Application Monitoring service type or instance name '{0}' contains invalid characters '{1}'. Valid characters are 0-9, a-z, A-Z, '_', '-', and space.
member.remarks: Displayed if a configured name contains an unsupported character. {0} will be replaced by the name as it is configured, {1} will be the list of invalid characters.

member.name: F:Tridion.Localization.ResourceCommon.tcs_msgUnknownUserName
member.summary: Resource identifier for the string: Unable to find User with {0} username in {1} DirectoryService.
member.remarks: This exception is thrown when a user with userName could not be found in a directory service instance.

member.remarks: This exception is thrown when a user with userName or password is not valid.

member.name: T:Tridion.Logging.LoggingCategory
member.summary: Specifies common logging categories used by the Tridion Common Library itself.
member.remarks: Other components that want to log messages should use their own enumeration of logging categories rather than using members of this enumeration.

member.name: F:Tridion.Logging.LoggingCategory.General
member.summary: Used for general exceptions like TridionNotSupportedException.

member.name: F:Tridion.Logging.LoggingCategory.Configuration
member.summary: Used for throwning exceptions that have to do with configuration.

member.name: F:Tridion.Logging.LoggingCategory.Logging
member.summary: Used for throwing exceptions that have to do with logging.

member.name: F:Tridion.Logging.LoggingCategory.Licensing
member.summary: Used for throwing exceptions that have to do with licensing.

member.name: F:Tridion.Logging.LoggingCategory.Localization
member.summary: Used for throwing exceptions that have to do with localization.

member.name: F:Tridion.Logging.LoggingCategory.ApplicationMonitoring
member.summary: Used for throwing exceptions that have to do with application monitoring.

member.name: F:Tridion.Logging.LoggingCategory.Security
member.summary: Used for throwing exceptions that have to do with security.

member.name: F:Tridion.Logging.LoggingCategory.Tracing
member.summary: Used for method entry/exit tracing.
